v.v: Then Yahweh called to Job out of a fierce storm and said,
“Who is this who brings darkness to plans
Now gird up your loins like a man
Where were you when I laid the earth’s foundations?
Who determined its dimensions? Tell me, if you know.
On what were its foundations laid?
when the morning stars sang together
Who shut up the sea with doors
when I made clouds its clothing,
That was when I marked out for the sea my boundary,
and when I said to it, ‘You may come this far, but no farther;
Have you given orders to the morning,
so that it might take hold of the edges of the earth
The earth is changed in appearance like clay changes under a seal;
From wicked people their ‘light’ is taken away;
Have you gone to the sources of the waters of the sea?
Have the gates of death been revealed to you?
Have you understood the earth in its expanse?
Where is the way to the resting place of light—
Can you lead light and darkness to their places of work?
Undoubtedly you know, for you were born then;
Have you entered the storehouses for the snow,
these things that I have kept for times of trouble,
What is the path to where the lightning bolts are distributed
Who has created the channels for the floods of rain,
to cause it to rain on lands where no person exists,
to satisfy the devastated and desolate places,
Does the rain have a father,
Out of whose womb did the ice come?
The waters hide themselves and become like stone;
Can you fasten chains on the Pleiades,
Can you lead the constellations to appear at their proper times?
Do you know the regulations of the sky?
Can you raise your voice up to the clouds,
Can you send out bolts of lightning that they may go out,
Who has put wisdom in the clouds
Who can number the clouds by his skill?
when the dust runs into a hard mass
Can you hunt down a victim for a lioness
when they are crouching in their dens
Who provides victims for the ravens

v: by means of words without knowledge?
for I will ask you questions, and you must answer me.
Tell me, if you have so much understanding.
Who stretched the measuring line over it?
Who laid its cornerstone
and all the sons of God shouted for joy?
when it burst out, as if it had come out of the womb—
and thick darkness its swaddling bands?
and when I placed its bars and doors,
here is where I will put a boundary to the pride of your waves.’
or caused the dawn to know its place,
and shake the wicked out of it?
all things on it stand out clearly like the folds of a piece of clothing.
their uplifted arm is broken.
Have you walked in the lowest parts of the deep?
Have you seen the gates of the shadow of death?
Tell me, if you know it all.
as for darkness, where is its place?
Can you find the way back to their houses for them?
the number of your days is so large!
or have you seen the storehouses for the hail,
for days of battle and war?
or to where the winds are scattered from the east over the earth?
or who has made a path for the thunder,
and on the wilderness, in which there is no one,
and to make the ground sprout with grass?
or, who fathers the drops of dew?
Who bore the white frost out of the sky?
the surface of the deep becomes frozen.
or undo the cords of Orion?
Can you guide the Bear with its children?
Could you set in place the sky’s rule over the earth?
so that an abundance of rainwater may cover you?
that they say to you, ‘Here we are’?
or has given understanding to the mists?
Who can pour out the water skins of the sky
and the clods of earth clump tightly together?
or satisfy the appetite of her young lion cubs
and sheltering in hiding to lie in wait?
when their young ones cry out to God
and stagger about for lack of food?
